content: cozy sporty socks by marie-elyse dugal ravelry marie-elyse dugal patterns tipoussins projects instagram @marieelysedugal #cozysportysocks each year i knit socks for my family i love using leftover yarn and every year i think of a different way to use it i wanted to share this year s recipe with you all and i hope it makes you and your loved ones happy #cozysportysocks page 1 of 5 marie-elyse dugal designs yarn and notions yarn 100g fingering weight yarn 350-425 yards / 320-390 metres total * i suggest 50-70 g of a main colour and 10-15g of each contrasting colour samples in leftovers of super sock 75% merino 25% nylon by tippy tree yarns needles - 2 25 mm needles with a long cable for magic loop other notions stitch markers scissors darning needle gauge 8-9 sts = 1 inch / 2 5cm in ribbing with the smaller needles 2 25 mm sizes *choose a size that is slightly smaller than your foot circumference for a snug fit - small 56 sts finished circumference 7 inches - medium 64 sts finished circumference 8 inches - large 72 sts finished circumference 9 inches notes - the instructions are written for 3 colours you may of course decide to knit these socks in only one colour by simply ignoring the instructions for colour changes you can also use just one contrasting colour or even multiple colours as you prefer abbreviations co cast on bor beginning of round k knit p purl k2tog knit 2 stitches together ssk slip slip knit slip the next 2 stitches consecutively knitwise then return these stitches to the left needle and knit them together through the back loop sl slip_stitch purlwise unless otherwise specified sl wyf slip_stitch purlwise while holding the yarn in front of work sl wyb slip_stitch purlwise while holding the yarn at back of work mc main colour cc1 contrast colour 1 cc2 contrast colour 2 #cozysportysocks page 2 of 5 marie-elyse dugal designs instructions cast on and cuff using mc co 56 64 72 stitches using your preferred stretchy method such as long tail or german twisted separate stitches equally in two 28 32 36 sts per needle if using magic loop or as needed if using another method joining in the round place bor marker establish 3x1 ribbing as follows set up round *k3 p1 repeat from * to end of round repeat this round a further 19 times 20 rounds total as per sample you may choose to knit fewer rounds if you prefer cut mc contrasting stripes switch to cc1 round 1 knit to end rounds 2-6 *k3 p1 repeat from * to end of round cut cc1 switch to mc round 1 knit to end rounds 2-4 *k3 p1 repeat from * to end of round cut mc switch to cc2 round 1 knit to end rounds 2-6 *k3 p1 repeat from * to end of round cut cc2 switch to mc round 1 knit to end rounds 2-4 *k3
